question_text: You have 1,000 virtual machines hosted on the Hyper-V hosts in a data center. You plan to migrate all the virtual machines to an Azure pay-as-you-go subscription. You need to identify which expenditure model to use for the planned Azure solution. Which expenditure model should you identify?
explanation:
The correct answer is:
✅ Operational

Why:
An Azure pay-as-you-go subscription uses an operational expenditure (OpEx) model. You pay for compute, storage, and networking as you consume them, rather than buying hardware upfront.

Quick check on the other options:
❌ Capital – This applies to on-premises infrastructure where you purchase hardware in advance (CapEx).
❌ Elastic – This is a cloud characteristic, not an expenditure model.
❌ Scalable – Also a feature, not a cost model.

So for migrating on-prem Hyper-V VMs to Azure pay-as-you-go → Operational expenditure is the right choice. ✔️
